      protected void updateScrollElemLength()
      Set the length of the scroll element so that the ratio of the length of the scroll button to the height of the scrollbar equals the ratio of the height of the content area to the height of the content.

    • Method Detail

      • updateScrollElemLength

        protected void updateScrollElemLength()
        Set the length of the scroll element so that the ratio of the length of the scroll button to the height of the scrollbar equals the ratio of the height of the content area to the height of the content.
        Specified by:
        updateScrollElemLength in class Scrollbar

      • setEnabled

        protected void setEnabled()
        Enable or disable the scrollbar based on the content size.
        Specified by:
        setEnabled in class Scrollbar
        Postcondition:
        The scrollbar is enabled if the height is smaller than the content size.
            new.isEnabled() == getHeight() < getContentSize()

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(int height)
        Set the height of this scrollbar, update the step size and update the position of the scroll element.
        Overrides:
        setHeight in class Component
        Parameters:
        height - The new height of the component.
        Effect:
        The scrollbar's step size is set to 10% of the height.
            setStepSize(0.15 * (height - getScrollElemLength())

      • setY

        public void setY(int y)
        Set the y coordinate for this scrollbar and update the position of the scroll element.
        Overrides:
        setY in class Component
        Parameters:
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the component.
        Effects:
      • The setY method of the superclass is called.
            super.setY(y)
      • The dimensionsChanged method is called.
            dimensionsChanged()

      • updateOffset

        protected void updateOffset()
        Change the offset to the new value determined by the scroll position.
        Specified by:
        updateOffset in class Scrollbar
        Effect:
        The setOffset method is called with the the percentage of the maxOffset that corresponds to the percentage of the scrollbar that is before the scroll element as argument.
            setOffset(getScrollPosition() / getHeight() * maxOffset)

      • setMaxOffset

      • isBeforeScrollElement

        protected boolean isBeforeScrollElement(int x,
                                        int y)
        Check if the given x,y coordinate is above (before) or below (after) the scroll element.
        Specified by:
        isBeforeScrollElement in class Scrollbar
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate for which to check.
        y - The y coordinate for which to check.
        Returns:
        True if the specified pair is above the scroll element, false otherwise.

        Specified by:
